> <OLD - WHEELIE>
>
> At this point, WHEELIE had found two things.  That this group was not
> exactly friends, but nor were they enemies.  Not registering them on his
> sensors, and not seeing any faction insignias upon them made him much more
> cautious.  But they also did not seem like Unicronians, for such would have
> attacked him or tried to play a sort of game.  So, with his energon
> slingshot over in his hand, and still charged, glancing up at the group he
> gave a bit of a bow.
>
> Then, piping up, "As much as it intrigues me to say, you are a mystery that
> we have found out today."  Wheelie continued, going on, "And I don't know,
> why are you here, what do you do, and whom was the one here that you spoke
> of that do?"  His speach falling into old patterns now.
>
> Glancing at the female, whom had identified herself as ASTRA, WHEELIE then
> spoke, "HOw does one know who would stamp out life?  For in this world, many
> are here who give strife?  It is better to know, when knows one does not,
> who is an enemy and who shall not rot.  For when one sees what one does not
> know, a direct method is the way to go.  For I do not konw if you are my
> friend.."  Tapping at his Autobot symbol, and hten pointing at their lack of
> insignia.  "And I do not konw if you are my enemy, and thus I must be ready
> to defend.  So, in that case, the way to go..  Is do something that will let
> out the emotion and it to flow."
>
> Still glancing up at ASTRA and FIREHORN warily, he continued his speaking,
> "I do not know for whom you fight, or if you will try to send me into this
> bad night.  But for what I know, and what you have here, something strange
> is about, and it is near.  I go in search of my friend, to find out if he
> has met his end.  I do not know if he was who came near this place, or
> someone else did who showed his face.  So please, do let me know, what you
> hae seen and has come to go."
>
> Telling, essentially, 'why' he had acted the way he did in his own
> roundabout style to try and bait them, to see if they would attack him or
> restrain themselves and thus be identifiable.  And explaining that he had
> done so by their lack of faction insignia and the fact that there were many
> possible enemies on this planet, and thus one could never assume whom anyone
> was an ally of, or an enemy.

<NEW>

There was a pause from both of them as they took a moment to puzzle
out WHEELIE's words, gathering the meaning from his lyrics.

"The small one does speak strangely." FIREHORN said as he shook his
head and rested the butt end of his axe on the ground, obviously going
back to a far more relaxed position.

He looked at WHEELIE squarely, "We belong to no one but ourselves
here." His words holding a certain amount of dignity. "He hold this
part of the jungle by hoof and blade."

ASTRA nodded, "We can take you to Unus and the other one who is like
you." She pointed to WHEELIE's symbol, "Perhaps there answers can be
met?" She looked back and forth between WHEELIE and FIREHORN.

FIREHORN nodded and then looked at WHEELIE, "Then who be you? You have
heard our names but we have not heard yours. We cannot let strangers
pass into our gates."

(TAG)

Preston
